campaign.story:
Recipes for a Zesty Life
A stunning 8.5x11” coffee table book, bursting with over 350 pages of inspiration, practical guidance, and beautiful photography; Recipes for a Zesty Life is a soulful book that will help you unearth the torch for finding your way in life, health, love, relationships and career. A unique blend of healthy plant-based recipes, nutrition, short stories, practices and habits for realizing your potential and harnessing your power to change your life—and the world. 
My funding goal is $15,000. These funds will help with the cost for printing 1000 books from a well-established Canadian printer using FSC® Certified, responsibly-sourced paper. With your help, we can spread a positive message and encourage a world of compassion, love, wellness, self-acceptance and inner fullness. 
Hi, I'm Rachelle Hynes
I've always had bit of an untamable spirit for risk-taking and adventure. This innate desire is partly what thrust me deep into life's arduous classroom fairly early in life. By the time I hit 30, I'd been through an unusual measure of adversity, successes and failures. 
I believe people are craving inspiration from every day human beings—not just superhuman athletes or wealthy media personalities. And that’s what I’m offering. The book is a heart-felt expression of the lessons I've learned, and am still learning; and the components I feel have allowed me to live a zestier, happier and more meaningful life. Each component is covered within each chapter, and the book takes a 360 degree approach to wellness; incorporating mental, physical, spiritual, and emotional well-being. 
Why It's Needed
In today’s society, many of us are struggling with anxiety, health, and finding purpose. Everywhere you turn, you're constantly bombarded with messages on how to “look better”, "obtain more stuff,"  and "be perfect". This is not healthy.
My book aims to help you uncover your inner greatness, and teach you skills to show up in the world authentic, confident and brave; with healthy tools for your journey. 
Amusing and inspirational stories & delicious recipes—Rachelle writes with a sense of humour you’ll thoroughly enjoy!
Target Market
The customer who will buy this book is looking for guidance on their journey. They don’t want to be overwhelmed with facts, complicated recipes and diets. They want to be nurtured, and they want simplicity.
Specifically, people who are thinking about exercise, self-worth and their bodies; exploring meditation, self-awareness and taking care of their minds; who are concerned about nutrition, finding purpose and motivation; and those who want to get back in touch with their body, manage the anxiety of aging and navigate the changes in their bodies with grace.  
Why you'll love it
People are grasping for ways to be healthier, happier and more fulfilled. This is an approachable and captivating coffee table book to reach for when you need inspiration and guidance; whether it’s strengthening your mind-body connection, uncovering your purpose and potential, getting through life’s struggles, or cultivating habits for lifelong health, wellness and happiness—this is the your handbook.
 Learn more about Rachelle at:  https://zestylife.ca/  Instagram: @zestylife.ca
Book Q&A
What’s in it for me? 
You lead a busy life, and you want new meals that taste amazing, are  easy to prepare, and leave you feeling great after. I put a lot of time  into creating, testing and getting feedback on a variety of plant-based  recipes that are both tasty and satisfying!
You’ll also discover a healthy dose of inspirational content, from  short stories to easy to digest tips and tools. This book is something  to keep handy for when you need a quick pick-me-up, a last minute recipe idea, or you simply want to flip through some pretty awesome photography!
Do I have to be a vegan to buy your book? 
Heck no! These meals taste great and just happen to be vegan. Try them out and see how they make you feel. They can be a nice addition to your weekly meals, or a bridge to consuming less animal based foods in your regimen.
What’s in it for you?
Through writing and designing this book I have learned more about myself, and been able to delve deep into a heartfelt passion for  helping others. My aim is to share my experiences, insights, stories and  practices so that you can feel more vibrant, healthy and happy in your life. I hope that people enjoy this book so I can keep creating more zesty content.
Are your ingredients hard to find?
Not at all! You’ll be able to create quick and healthy meals, and have FUN doing it! These recipes have unique and complex flavours with some pretty basic ingredients that anyone can put together!
If I buy one cookbook this year why should this be the one?
This book is so much more than recipes, it’s a vulnerable expression of my own journey and I would like it to light the path in a potent way for as many people as possible, with respect to not only how they think about food and health, but to really propel them to understand that we’re all capable of so much more and have an important ingredient to offer this world. Recipes for a Zesty Life is about believing in and feeding your untapped potential. In my book you will find a 360 degree approach to life, with  insightful stories, worksheets for uncovering more of who you are,  inspirational content, nutrition and cooking tips and tools, and so much more!

As a professional designer and branding expert, there is no cost or risk or challenge associated with design or marketing of the book. The book has been fully designed and is completed.

The challenge will be gaining enough funds to cover minimum quantity printing fees, and retailer/distributor fees.

updates.update_userinfo: How do you like the book?
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone!
Thank you so much for all of the support and patience in getting Recipes for a Zesty Life out into the world! It is because of all of you who expressed heavy interest in reading my book, and continued to support my desire, that I was able to self-publish. 
Since launch I've received so many warm reviews and congratulatory notes and that makes me feel incredibly grateful and humbled. THANKS! If you've received your book and dove into the pages already, I would love to hear your thoughts and what recipes or stories stand out for you! You can write a review at the website shop https://zestylife.ca/product/recipes-for-a-zesty-life/ — much appreciated!

Happy Holidays everyone!!!
I hope you all receive your books very soon! In the meantime, here is your ebook + bonus content. Thank you so much for all of the support in making this book happen!
DOWNLOAD LINK: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1TMYlSrD8WDjUgEuUc0vwMhtyDIcrrVsP/view?usp=sharing
Zesty Wishes in 2020!

Hi Everyone,
Thankyou so much for your patience! We are a tad behind getting the books from the printer due to Christmas holidays. Sorry!! We are waiting and ready to fire them off to you as soon as they arrive (Friday), so please stand by...
Thanks so much for the support and patience, I hope you LOVE it =:D

Hi everyone,
I am super excited to announce we've reached our funding goal and you will have your book before Christmas!!! Thank-you for believing in this dream of mine and supporting all of the hard work it has taken to get here! I hope you thoroughly enjoy the book and I can't wait to get your feedback!
There's still time to pre-order, so if you know of anyone who would like a copy, you can still send them the Kickstarter link!

campaign.story:
Under An Arctic Sky is a film project documenting a journey to the most remote corners of Iceland in the middle of winter in search of perfect surf. 
In this 40 minute film, six surfers set sail along the frozen shores of Iceland as the worst storm in twenty-five years is about to arrive. The storm blows through, shuts down the country, and turns the search for waves into a life-threatening prospect.
Despite constant darkness and stormy seas, the group continues the hunt for perfect waves and attempts to make history by surfing under the northern lights.
After reaching our initial goal of $150K, we created these stretch goal bonuses as a 'thank you' for your continued support. Every time a stretch goal is "reached" backers will get extra stuff for no additional cost (scroll down to see a complete list of backer rewards and information about the film tour).
      Plainly put, Kickstarter is the fastest, most-effective way we could think of to get this film into your hands. But your pledge is more than just a pre-order of the film. By supporting this Kickstarter, you'll get the film first and help us to finish post-production as well accomplish a worldwide film tour. 
Our goal is to visit and share this project with as many cities as we can. We've already spent a lot of out-of-pocket money making the film. But the $150K goal is important, because it will cover the costs associated with distributing this film to a global audience. We want to come to your cities in person, share the film and photographs with you and answer any questions you might have about the filmmaking process. Our goal is that you will leave inspired to get out and seek these experiences for yourself.   
Stay tuned for the dates and showtimes of our global film tour. Under an Arctic Sky is also an official selection into the Tribeca Film Festival (2017). Tickets for Tribeca go on sale March 28th at 11 am EST. For TFF premier showtimes and other information, click the following link:
https://tribecafilm.com/filmguide?film_duration=Short&page=6
We don't want you to feel like you're giving us money and not getting value in return. We're keeping the reward levels simple and few. We hope you value the rewards like you would any other purchase. Also, all backers above $15 get to come to a designated premier of their choice.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Cold weather, hypothermia, floating ice chunks, flat light, delayed flights, broken boards, broken bones, death, bad surf, viking attacks, and drone malfunctions. 

But seriously, THIS FILM WILL BE COMPLETED NO MATTER WHAT! 

Our major challenge will be getting out on the road and bringing this film to as many cities as possible. We're fully capable of executing this tour, but it won't mean much without your collaboration. Let us know in the comments which cities you want us to consider stopping in. And if you feel like there's no chance we'll come to your small, podunk town reach out to us and we will do our best to make it happen!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: The wait is over! THE FILM IS LIVE!
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
Your individual download links have been emailed to you through the CrowdOx platform we've been using to fulfill everyones backer rewards. If you click the link provided on the email you received and log into your Vimeo account (yes you will need a Vimeo account!) you will be granted access to the film! You can stream it from your account or download it. Make sure you're logged into whatever Vimeo account you want this film to live on permanently because the link will only work once!

Hi everyone! 
The wait is almost over. We are excited to release Under An Arctic Sky to all backers on August 1st! I know we were initially aiming for a late June release on the digital downloads of the Under An Arctic Sky film. Unfortunately, our distribution partner wasn't going to be able to finalize everything for release by that date. I wish I had better news for you, but where we currently stand with iTunes, Vimeo, etc, is that we won't be able to send out the unique download codes for our backers until August 1st. I know this obviously comes at a bit of a surprise and bummer to many of you! Again, we wish we could do something about it, but due to the intricacies of releasing a film and getting download codes out to 4,800 people and taking into account the potential piracy concerns around a release of that magnitude we have been forced to postpone. This is our first stab at a project this big so we really appreciate your patience with us. Just know that we want to get this film out to you ASAP and we are so grateful for your support of this project overall! You will all have the film for over a month before anyone else is able to get their hands on it! Official release date will be September 5th for everyone else.

Hey Backers!
Stoked to see everyone that's been receiving their backer rewards. I've seen all of you tagging me in your posts / stories!
Quick update and answer for many of you in regards to the digital downloads. They will be provided via VIMEO since we've had an influx of requests from those of you that don't have or don't use iTunes. This will allow everyone to be able to access the film when we send out the download codes.

Hi Everyone!
Hope all is well. 
We are still in the process of shipping everything out (4,500+ shipments to make) I'm sure you've seen us working away in the studio on my Instagram stories! Currently we're about 50% done so thanks again for your patience. It's greatly appreciated while we put all of our efforts into getting everything shipped out.

Hey backers!!
We're taking a quick break from tour life to send this update about the digital download. We've had a lot of questions about when the download will be sent out. We've started shipping everything out and I know a lot of you have received books and/or t-shirts already! The film will be following shortly (via email) with a unique download code. The reason for this delay is because of the finalization process through iTunes, but we promise it's coming soon!
Hey backers!

updates.update_content:
Fill Out the Backer Survey ASAP
We wanted to let you know that the backer surveys have been sent to you via email. Keep an eye out for that in your inbox and fill it out as soon as you can! Please, don't email us your address since we won't be able to keep track of 4000+ emails very well! Instead it would be great if you could follow the instructions provided in the survey email. This will make the process run a lot smoother and allow us to get your rewards out quickly. It's also an opportunity for you to add to your reward if you didn't get everything you wanted, or maybe you are looking at getting extra copies for friends and family.
The Digital Download Is Coming Soon!

campaign.story:
---
u·ni·corn
1. one with vision, a persistent and dedicated human
2. a nonprofit or foundation employee that shines with brilliance and humility
---
We are inviting all unicorns to participate in changing our sector. Our goal is to change the way we all approach funding and fund raising. 
Jane Leu (CEO of Smarter Good), Vu Le (writer of Nonprofits with Balls), and Jessamyn Shams-Lau (ED of the Peery Foundation), will be writing a book together in 2017. And we want your help!
Smart funders know that the current status quo is inherently funder-centric and are looking for ways to balance the playing field. Adopting grantee-centric practices means creating funder interactions that maximize the input of time and only strengthen an organization’s ability to achieve their outcomes—interactions that put grantees, and hence impact, first.
Wise nonprofits know that current practices perpetuate a broken system. They also acknowledge their role in perpetuating funder-centric processes. More importantly they recognize their power to change the status quo and shape interactions with funders. They know they have more power than many admit and they are looking for ways to exercise it.
This book will delve into both sides -- funder and fundraiser, foundation and nonprofit -- to explore and suggest practical ways all of us can change our ways of operating from 'business as usual' to 'nonprofit as extraordinary'. 
There is much work to be led and done by unicorns. Now more than ever, we need ways to work together that are fast, equal, and efficient. 
Cover Design
There are loads of books on nonprofit and philanthropy. We looked at many of them and discovered a common theme - they are shaped, tempered, and endorsed by foundations. We are turning that model on its head. Instead, we want nonprofits to back this book significantly (and have the opportunity to shape it), as well as philanthropy professionals who are eager to spread a more grantee-centric approach to funding. So we’re asking you, the unicorns, to contribute.
Our Kickstarter campaign launches today, December 1st and will run until December 30th. This campaign will not only raise money for self-publishing (there will be no superfluous padding in our book -- just what you need to make change!), but also to ensure that it is shaped by your perspective and contributions. See the rewards levels for how your ideas and voice can be incorporated.
Chapter Outline
We’ll be writing this book throughout 2017, and releasing excerpts to our Kickstarter supporters along the way. We hope that you’ll support us in the coming weeks and share our vision with your network.
Thank you, in anticipation of your support!
Jane / Vu / Jessamyn
---
About the authors:
Jane Leu
Jane Leu is an internationally recognized social entrepreneur and Ashoka Fellow with more than 20 years of experience in founding and leading numerous social enterprises. Her latest venture is Smarter Good, a global services firm with a dual mission to improve the efficiency and impact of small nonprofit organizations and create purposeful careers for aspiring changemakers in emerging markets. 
Jane’s contributions and leadership have been recognized by BYU Social Innovator of the Year, John F. Kennedy New Frontier Award, the Rockefeller Foundation Next Generation Leadership program, Jefferson Award for Community Service, Draper Richards Kaplan Foundation for Social Entrepreneurship and the Manhattan Institute Social Entrepreneur Award, among others. She is a Draper Richards Kaplan Foundation Venture Partner, representing the foundation’s investment on the Board of Directors of Reset Foundation, a member of the advisory boards of the Peery Family Foundation, Joshua Venture Group and the Migration Policy Institute. 
She holds a MA from Columbia University’s School of International and Public Affairs and a BA from Tufts University. She lives in San Francisco, CA with her husband, Ted Levinson, a social finance professional, when she is not in Manila with the team of Smarter Good.
Vu Le
Vu Le (“voo lay”) is a writer, speaker, vegan, Pisces, and the Executive Director of Rainier Valley Corps, a nonprofit in Seattle with the mission of developing and supporting leaders of color to strengthen the capacity of communities-of-color-led nonprofits and foster collaboration between diverse communities to effect systemic change.
Vu’s passion to make the world better, combined with a low score on the Law School Admission Test, drove him into the field of nonprofit work, where he learned that we should take the work seriously, but not ourselves. There’s tons of humor in the nonprofit world, and someone needs to document it. He is going to do that, with the hope that one day, a TV producer will see how cool and interesting our field is and make a show about nonprofit work, featuring attractive actors attending strategic planning meetings and filing 990 tax forms.
Known for his no-BS approach, irreverent sense of humor, and love of unicorns, Vu has been featured in dozens, if not hundreds, of his own blog posts at nonprofitwithballs.com.
Jessamyn Shams-Lau
High school drop out turned MBA, Jessamyn currently co-creates and stewards the Peery Foundation's Grantee-Centric approach to philanthropy. Jessamyn is an advocate for inter-disciplinary approaches, thoughtful risk taking, and bold ideas developed through apprenticing with a problem.
Jessamyn joined the Peery Foundation as its first staff member in 2009, helping to shape the foundation’s initial approach and portfolios. Currently, as Executive Director, Jessamyn is responsible for supporting the Peery Foundation team, developing and guiding overall strategy, and bringing the Foundation Board's vision to life. Jessamyn utilizes her experience as part of the founding Ashoka U team in her hands-on role as a Board Member of BYU’s Ballard Center, where she has created curriculum now taught at both the undergraduate and graduate levels. 
Jessamyn has a BA in Fine Arts from the University of the Arts London and an MBA from Brigham Young University. She lives in Palo Alto with her ridiculously funny husband and three tiny hamsters.
---
---
Music in video: "George Baker Section - Little Green Bag (CRISSP & The Fixer Remix)” by CRISSP MUSIC is licensed under CC BY.
---
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge for us will be finding time to create the content of the book. We all have full-time jobs, and Jane and Vu have a couple of them.

We already have the frameworks for funders and fundraisers, so we're part of the way there, but it will take a significant number of hours to write and build the rest of the book. This is why we've set rewards levels with deliverables at intervals during the year--to keep us on track. We'll be sure to communicate any delays or challenges along the way. 

If you know us personally, you're more than welcome to ask us how our progress is going too! 

But most of all we're just excited to do this. Thank you for believing in us, and the importance of this change in our sector.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Solar Crusaders is a multiplayer top-down strategy game featuring 4X gameplay elements, sandbox universe, real-time battles, and simulated virtual economy.
You'll control the crews of customizable spaceships and space-stations in a galaxy populated by other players and A.I. controlled NPCs.
Solar Crusaders features in a nutshell:
Open world space exploration with top-down tactical battles.
Command and battle against multiple ships, with up to four ships under your command.
Colonize and exploit strategic locations by building space-stations. 
Participate in the simulated game economy by mining ores, refining fuels, or manufacturing ships, stations, and components.
Compete against other players and NPC's to develop faster and more powerful ships, and gain territory for your corporation.
About Us:
Solar Crusaders is being made by Silicon Valley startup Puremana Studios LLC, founded by Hilary Craven, and Ollie JD. We're self-funded and we have enough money to make sure this game happens. Our core team is locked in and committed to this project for the next 2 years.
We're a little over half way through development, and we've decided to come to Kickstarter to raise awareness about Solar Crusaders, and raise funds to accelerate the development schedule by increasing the size of our team.
We're testing the waters with this premise, and we want you to help us prove that there is a significant group of people that would love to play a 2D open world space game!
Website: http://www.solarcrusaders.com/
Greenlight: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=409453472
Explore the galaxy
As you guide your fleet through each solar system, you'll explore features such as stars, moons, planets, asteroids, and singularities; optionally colonizing strategic locations as you see fit.
Unlike similar games in this genre, Solar Crusaders utilizes an advanced agents system to populate the game universe with persistent computer controlled pirates, merchants, traders, smugglers, and more. The game will never feel empty or barren, because the computer will move into empty sectors.
Once an agent is destroyed, it permanently ceases to exist, and a new agent will be created unless you move in to take its place.
Grow your empire
Colonization will allow you to create items in the game, which will range in quality based on your manufacturing facilities and proper composition of resources.
Anything from small sensor augments, to full ship systems like engines, transporters, and cloak can be created and traded in-game.
Manage your crew members
Your crew will be composed of five different races including Human, Monk, Plantoid, Robotic, and Creature. Each race will have their own appearance, behavior, and special ability; affording each a particular advantage in combat, diplomacy, or a wide variety of other possible enhancements.
Each crew member will be subject to perma-death, although this can be mitigated through insurance, and cloning bays.
Take command of your ships
Your ships will be highly configurable, with many systems being swappable and/or upgradable. You'll have to carefully manage your critical resources including fuel, atmosphere, and ammunition; while at the same time manage your crew as they perform their specialized duties like piloting, engineering, weapons control, and more.
Additional supplies and reinforcements can be salvaged from wrecks, created from resources, or bought from NPCs and other players.
Domination
The advancement system is based upon training individual skills of crew members in fields such as piloting, shields, engineering, weapons, and more. Ultimately, your goal will be to expand your dominion beyond your home system, and into the furthest reaches of the galaxy.
 The game can be played in 3 different ways:
Single-player Battle Simulations (similar to Star Citizens Arena Commander)
Local Co-op (much like Minecraft where you host the server yourself for up to 64 players over LAN)
Connect to Official Online Game Universe (much like an MMO, persistent universe with up to 8000+ players)
Single-player and local co-op will NEVER have any monthly fee to play. You will NEVER have to sign-up or sign-in to anything to play. Simply download and play as much as you wish.
There will NEVER be a fee to play on the Official Game Universe for Kickstarter supporters of $30.00 or more.
Otherwise, the Official Online Game Universe will be $5.00/month, and possibly less with promotions and deals.
There will be a limited micro-payments shop, which will allow players to buy things that do NOT affect the balance of the game. For example, you'll be able to purchase unique decals (skins) for ship and space-stations.
We are currently focusing on development of the Solar Crusaders Official Online Game Universe.
The Kickstarter funds budget above shows where your money will be spent.
We'll be hiring a 3-month contract programmer to help with debugging and and code optimization. We haven't chosen our programmer yet.
We'll be hiring on a contract artist to create more concept artwork. Concept artwork will be done by Becca Bair and Ricardo Van Duuren.
We'll be hiring Megan McDuffee to do our music.
Game development isn't easy, and as any enterprising game developer or startup entrepreneur knows, programming is expensive. Running a company has a lot of overhead, and therefore a project such as this can easily run in to the millions.
So how we can make this game happen for way less?
1) Solar Crusaders has an experienced lead engineer / programmer as one of its founding members. Ollie JD has been working in the Silicon Valley for over 10 years, and has brought many large scale projects to fruition. He's not going anywhere, and he is fully committed to this project for at least next 2 years. This project has been a dream of his waiting for the right moment to spring to life.
2) We're using technology that is much easier to work with. The game engine and servers are built using JavaScript and HTML5, and therefore can share a lot of code. Sharing code is good, because it means less repetitive work, and fewer bugs. A lot of smart companies have invested heavily into JavaScript, including Google, PayPal, Flickr, LinkedIn and more.
3) Many indies use Unity to save a lot of time, and we're using similar frameworks for both our front-end and backend servers. We're not trying to re-invent the wheel, therefore, anything that has been made and open-sourced, we're going to be using. For more information about our architecture, see the technology section below.
4) The Solar Crusaders Online Universe will be hosted on Amazon Web Services. When server demand goes up, we spin up more servers and only pay for what we use. We don't have to pay for an IT department, because the servers are managed by Amazon.
5) All of our team members work remotely, there is no office, we meet and coordinate through Skype. We have practically no corporate overhead.
6) This game is a passion for all of us! We'll use a little bit of money, and a whole lot of heart to get it done.
So where are we now?
We've implemented most of the client engine, and we're currently spending most of our development time on the server. We've ran some preliminary stress tests, and here are our results:
Each Amazon EC2 instance can support 200-400 concurrent connections. With a cluster of 40 EC2 instances, and the artificial load we generated that accounts for realistic read/write operations, we were able to sustain 8000 simultaneous connections, each averaging a ping of 40-150ms.
The approximate cost of this setup was $1500.00-2500.00/month, not including the datastore setup, which would cost an additional $1500.00-3000.00/month.
Overall, it will be inexpensive to run the servers for a user-base of 8000.
Parallel Development
Our architecture is very unique; we can share almost all of the code between the different types of games (single-player, vs LAN multiplayer, vs MMO.)
In fact, the local co-op LAN multiplayer is really just a modified version of the MMO server. Instead of communicating with a database, it'll store everything in memory and serialize to a file upon saving the game. The main difference being that it'll run standalone, instead of in a clustered environment.
Hilary Craven - Founder / Game Designer - Hilary Craven has a passion for computer gaming that was largely influenced by her older brother. Raised in a family of board gamers she has always been looking to create a game. With a background and experience in business she is creating a game studio that will give back to the community. Currently still addicted to StarCraft and Civilizations.
Ollie JD - Founder / Game Architect - Ollie is a 10 year veteran of the SF tech industry, and has gained valuable experience working and consulting for Silicon Valley companies. He worked for PIX System developing video software used in HBO shows like Game of Thrones and House of Cards. He was the lead engineer on the Sports Illustrated Snapshot Chrome App.
Erica Parker - Business Dev - Erica leads our Business Development efforts to target strategic alliances and partnerships. In essense, she helps us make things happen that were previously unimaginable. Erica holds a Masters of Engineering from UC Berkeley. Her advise on legal and business aspects has been invaluable.
Megan McDuffee - Composer / Musician - Megan holds both a BA in Film Scoring with a minor in Electronic Music from the University of CA, Santa Cruz and a Master's Certificate from the Berklee College of Music in Orchestration for Film and TV. Her music can be heard in numerous films, advertisements, TV shows, and video games including Galaxy Heist. Megan's piece "Kingdoms" is featured on Solar Crusaders first teaser video. We are looking forward for Megan creating unique pieces for Solar Crusaders.
Federico Pereiro - Programmer - Federico is a full-stack JavaScript freelance developer and open source contributor. Originally from Buenos Aires, Argentina, Federico is now taking his work on the road, which brings him to distant and exotic places - provided they have an electric outlet and wifi.
Aron Gerencser - Writer / Lore Master - Aron is a student and aspiring writer based in Budapest. A passionate gamer for as long as he can remember, Aron is a massive fan of anything and everything Sci-Fi. Be it high-tech space operas, post-apocalyptic dramas or abstract thrillers, if It's Science Fiction, Aron likes it.

We are building Solar Crusaders using standard web technologies. Both the backend servers and the front-end game client will share code. This means that we'll be able to add features and fix bugs much faster than otherwise possible with other architectures.
The game will run in a web browser using no plugins, however, it will also be available as a regular game you can download and run (just like with any other Steam game.)
It will be incredibly easy to join the game universe, which means that there will be more players online at any given time.
Web-based technologies such as HTML5 and Node.js have come a long way in the past few years, and it is now possible to create high quality games that are virtually identical to their native counterparts.
Obviously, you won't see the next Crysis or Farcry on the web, but simpler games just don't need to be built using C++ anymore. HTML 5 game engines now support GPU accelerated graphics, and can even be distributed through Steam.
See BabylonJS and Pixi.js to see some tech demos. Also checkout Cross Code, a completed game using this new technology.
 Audio and visual quality in games has improved immensely over the past 10 years, however, game artificial intelligence has been largely overlooked by developers. Nowadays, the quality of the AI can really make or break the experience gamers have when playing the latest titles.
We aim to endue the NPCs in Solar Crusaders with intelligent tactical behavior that goes a step beyond rule-based, or cheating techniques. The agents in Solar Crusaders will be controlled by an adaptive algorithm that corrects mistakes by taking into account previously won and lost battles, on a massive scale.
Every battle in Solar Crusaders will be analyzed and recorded by the algorythm. As more and more data is generated, the NPC agents will be able to to better deal with unknown and emergent human-player tactics.
The adaptive A.I. will only be available in the Online Universe, the single-player and co-op versions of the game will utilize a standard rule-based approach (but not cheating.)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
DEVELOPMENT

Solar Crusaders has been self-funded by the founders, and we've been able to secure salaries for core members of the team. We're committed to this project for the next 2 years.

Solar Crusaders will come to life, but the real question is how quickly. We've invested heavily into this project, and we know that we can make it happen.

TECHNOLOGY

We are using technology that allows us to develop and iterate quickly. Our servers will be using the same technology that is used by companies like Flickr, Uber, and Paypal to support thousands of users inexpensively.

COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT

We know we can make this game, but we will need the guidance of the community to provide feedback during our alpha testing phases. We want to make this game as fun as possible.

SPREADING THE WORD:

One of the larger challenges that we face is spreading awareness about our game. We could overcome this hurdle by funding an advertising campaign, but we would rather spend those funds to add new features into the game.

You, our Kickstarter backers can help us overcome this challenge. You have the power to spread awareness about Solar Crusaders by sharing our story with your friends and family on social media (Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, etc.)

We want to make this as easy as possible, so we have created a NEW Thunderclap which will automatically post one message to your social media, please join and help spread the word!

http://thndr.it/1H2bNEd
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Boy Who Spoke to the Earth is a tale about a young boy who asks the Earth where he can find happiness. The Earth responds and sends the boy on a journey to some of the landscapes that make the Earth most proud. In the end, the boy learns that happiness is harder to find than he expected.
This children’s book is written by surf and adventure photographer Chris Burkard, and illustrated by Disney Interactive artist David McClellan.
Dreamling Books is a children’s publishing company with the mission to inspire readers to follow their dreams and get out there and explore.
Help us get this book in the hands of children, parents, adventurers and explorers everywhere. We can’t make this book a reality without your help.
      Dreamling Books isn't just a publishing company, but also a community of writers, illustrators, readers, and dreamers sharing inspirational stories. We believe that stories are the most powerful way for all of us to share the lessons that matter most. We believe that we all have a story to tell, and we invite you to share yours. Learn more...

  We can’t make this book a reality without your help. We decided to launch this book on Kickstarter because right now it’s the only way for us to get the book into your hands. We are huge on collaboration and couldn’t be more excited to involve you in the project. Hopefully this book will inspire you and all the young people in your life to find joy in the journey.
Thank you!
- Chris, Dave, and the Dreamling Books team.
Chris Burkard: @chrisburkard
David McClellan: @mcclellan_art

campaign.story:
[video and high quality images of the production samples coming soon!]
NODE [6] is a minimal iPhone case that's designed to compliment the great thought and craft that goes into the new iPhone 6 and 6+.
Many minimal cases distract from the design of the phone and how it feels in your hand. LHOOQ Design has carefully designed NODE [6] to take its cues from the new iPhone. The new single-radius bevels around the entire perimeter of the phone is accented by the sphere of each NODE. Crafted from solid aluminum and finished to match the 3 iPhone colors, these corners are the perfect accessory for the design-minded individual.
 The size is designed to keep the phone off of any flat surface no matter the orientation (which solves the protruding camera lens problem while we're at it). Also, aluminum is a fairly soft metal which will deform upon impact, and we've provided enough thickness at the corner to help cushion a typical drop onto pavement. Extremely thin rubber pads and foam adhesive grip the edges of your phone and keep it held in place.
One set of NODES contains 6 individual pieces, so you have a few spares in case you drop your phone and damage one of the pieces. The iPhone 6 and 6+ are only 0.2mm different in thickness, and these have been designed to have enough rubber thickness to provide enough tolerance to accommodate either model.
Final prototypes after anodizing
Final prototypes before finishing

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The largest risk of this project is the timeline. We're really trying to push the schedule in order to deliver for Christmas of this year, but with this tight of a schedule we can only afford a few minor setbacks in the manufacturing process. If we aren't able to ship for Christmas, we will figure out some kind of mea culpa gift and beg your forgiveness.

The other risk comes from the final prototypes. We need to produce one more sample to ensure perfect fit and finish for both phone models. Given how minimal this case is, those tolerances are all-the-more important. We will fully communicate any issues we run into and get community feedback in order to develop the most appropriate solution.

The final risk: shipping. We are developing the best way to ship to you quickly with minimal packaging and waste, while still properly protecting them from the world's most infamous mail handlers. We'll add videos of the final unboxing once everything is ready to go!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

The documentary will be composed of interviews with Cambodian survivors of sex trafficking. This film will give these women the opportunity to share advice, encouragement, and a sense of being understood with other survivors. 
 We will initially distribute the documentary to survivor shelters in the US and Cambodia with the hope of sharing it in other regions.
A survivor's struggle does not end with her escape. She often deals with no work options, a lack of employable skills, and the strain of post-traumatic stress. Additionally, it is common for survivors to be rejected in their communities; sadly there is a stigma associated with the lives victims have suffered. 
With this in mind, we are creating this documentary. We hope the documentary will help survivors feel encouragement from other women who understand their experience and truly care.  
We will also distribute the documentary to a broader audience to help educate the public on the situation survivors face after they leave slavery. There is a dire need to help survivors reclaim their lives that were taken away. 
Rental equipment to film the documentary
Insurance for the film equipment
Airline tickets for the crew
Transportation and modest accommodations while filming 
Security guards while in Cambodia
Care packages for survivors in shelters that will include a copy of the documentary 
We appreciate the generous services of our creative director, producer, cinematographer, composer, and executive officers who are generously providing their services pro bono. 
“In organizing Pomelo Project, I’ve learned so much about human trafficking, an incredibly sad topic. But I’ve learned also incredible lessons about human goodness. For all the darkness and sadness that there is, there is also goodness. We, as a world, have every reason to hope.” Rebecca Lambson, CEO
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This project has had its share of challenges. The first challenge was deciding how to get involved. You hear of a subject as dire and heartbreaking as sex trafficking and wonder whatever you could do to make a meaningful difference. After months of thought and research, we felt a documentary was our avenue for that. One challenge we'll face in filming is maintaining the privacy of the survivors. Another is creating an environment during filming that is empowering and uplifting. More challenges will come, of course. But we have a great team, and we are dedicated to finding solutions as they do!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Our new goal is to reach as many people around the world as possible with Michele's powerful message. With $500,000 we'll be able to bring the film to 5 Billion people in 50 languages and film Michele's family scattering her ashes in the Ganges. Thank you for your help! 
50 LANGUAGES for 5 BILLION PEOPLE! - According to the World Health Organization, 85% of the more than 270,000 women that die from cervical cancer every year are from low and middle-income countries. It is the 2nd leading cancer in women with over 530,000 new cases every year. Our goal with Lady Ganga is to show the film as widely as we can. In many of the countries who really need this film (Including India), subtitles will not be enough because many people are not able to read the subtitles in their own language. Our goal is to have Lady Ganga dubbed (voice-over from local actors) in the 50 most prevalent languages that need this film! This will be a costly, but very beneficial undertaking for Michele’s cause. Having the film be heard in each of these languages will greatly increase the scope of who will be able to see this film. Our goal is to have the film screen ALL OVER THE WORLD. We want people to see the film in their native languages on television, in theatres, online as well as sponsored viewings by outreach groups and health workers in order educate people about cervical cancer and HPV. 
ADDITIONAL FILMING IN INDIA - We want to take a film crew to India where Michele traveled and follow-up with stories of local people along Michele’s path who have been affected by her journey. One of Michele’s last wishes was for her family to scatter her ashes in the Ganga. Filming this would offer an extremely powerful ending to an already powerful story.

This is our first Kickstarter campaign. When we decided to use it as a forum to raise money to finish Lady Ganga, we had no idea what we were going to get. First and foremost, we wanted to make sure that we were able to finish the film and had enough to do just that. Thanks to all of you, we have exceeded our initial goal...and that is AMAZING. You have guaranteed that this film will be made! As our pledges started to grow, so have our ambitions. Some of the things that we dreamed of doing with this documentary, we now believe could be accomplished…with your continued support.
Thank you very much! -- Frederic & Mark
Follow our progress:
Like Our Facebook Page!
Follow us on Twitter!
We have 6 new fantastic rewards!
DVDs and High Definition Blu-Rays of "Lady Ganga" with your company's brand.
Custom printed in full color with “Compliments of” your company name, logo and tagline on the case and disc. Give them as gifts to employees, patients and clients to share Michele’s incredible story and raise awareness about HPV and Cervical Cancer.
LADY GANGA - AN INSPIRING DOCUMENTARY
Michele Frazier Baldwin knew she was going to die. She knew this would be her last opportunity to make a difference in the World and what she did in the waning months of her life was truly remarkable…and she gave us full access to film it all, with nothing off-limits.
When Michele, a 45 year old Mother of three was diagnosed with late-stage cervical cancer, she took this as a call-to-action. She decided that she would travel to India to paddle board over 700 miles down the Ganges River, spreading awareness about this disease that was going to kill her and breaking a World Record in the process. 
Some of her friends and family doubted her decision to make the trip. They were concerned for her health and they understandably wanted to spend as much time with her as possible. But Michele felt a higher calling. She had a soft spot for the people of India and she knew that India had the highest mortality rate from cervical cancer in the World. More than 50,000 Indian women die needlessly every year from this preventable cancer. So, she packed her bags and explained to her kids why this was so important for her. They were sad to see her go, but they understood their Mom's final mission.
A cameraman went along with Michele on her epic voyage down the Ganga and captured beautiful and intimate footage of her journey. Michele did interviews and press with the Indian media along the way and did her best to spread the word. 
The truth is, cervical cancer is caused by a highly prevalent, sexually transmitted virus called HPV. 80% of ALL people under 50 years of age will be exposed to HPV at some point in their lives. Globally, HPV causes many types of cancers in both Men and Women. This is why Michele dreamed of making an even bigger impact, not just in India but all over the World. That dream of hers has become THIS FILM.
When she returned back home to her family in New Mexico, Michele's time was quickly coming to an end. As her health rapidly deteriorated, Michele wanted people to see the ugly realities of HPV and cervical cancer. Her hope was to inspire people to stay on top of their health, so nobody else would have to suffer from this disease. She also made arrangements for her own post-life ceremony. Michele's wishes were to have an open-pyre ceremony in the beautiful mountains of Colorado.
Soon after, with her friends and family by her side…Michele passed away. Her family honored her wishes and quickly transported her body to Crestone, Colorado, the only place in the US where open pyre funeral ceremonies are allowed. The next morning, the funeral ceremony was carried out. Her body was burned for all to see and Michele Baldwin's body was returned back to the elements.  
As Michele wished, we were there to film it all. It was a profoundly emotional and moving experience for us as well. Watching this strong and athletic woman wither away was tough to watch, but we also saw her come to peace with her dying and accept what was happening to her. It was a bittersweet message that made us appreciate our own lives and showed us just how much one person can accomplish in a short amount of time. This is also the message that we hope to convey with this documentary. 
Making a film like this one is time-consuming and expensive. We have over 150 hours of deeply moving interviews and footage that we still need to turn into a proper film. We have already gone deep into our own pockets and we have humbly realized that we will not be able to complete this film without YOUR HELP! 
Your contributions will go towards the entire post-production process. This includes writing, editing, animation, licensing, legal fees, translation, subtitles, insurance and the many other expenses go into completing and delivering a film. If our stretch goals are met they will go towards advertising, festival submissions, publicity and even distribution of the film.
We see this as an INSPIRATIONAL short-form documentary that will also help to educate and maybe even save lives. The story is heartbreaking and at times graphic, but ultimately, it shows Michele's passion and selfless courage to leave behind a meaningful and lasting legacy.
THANK YOU for being a part of this film!! Every contribution is important and will be used wisely. Some of you may not know that if we DO NOT MEET 100% of our funding goal by our closing date, we will not get ANY of the donations made and we will be back to $0. 
It is also important to try and raise as much money EARLY in the process so that we maintain a presence on the Kickstarter homepage, which will help get us more publicity and greatly help us reach our goal. Even if you are unable to help contribute financially, you can make a great contribution by helping us spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, email, word-of-mouth, smoke signals, or any other way you may communicate with people! 
Once the film is finished, 100% of profits from sales and licensing of the film will go to the Michele Baldwin Memorial Fund which is managed by ASHA (American Sexual Health Association), a 100 year old non-profit organization who run the NCCC (National Cervical Cancer Coalition) and the Global Initiative Against HPV and Cervical Cancer:
http://giahc.org/
http://www.ashasexualhealth.org/
http://www.nccc-online.org/
Thank you so much!!
Frederic Lumiere and Mark Hefti
___
Budget
Our goal is to make a remarkable film. One that will make an impact worldwide and do justice to Michele's legacy. To do that we need time and resources. The more resources we receive, the more ambitious we will be in creating this incredibly important project and distributing it around the world. Our dream is to have "Lady Ganga" translated in dozens of languages and available in every country around the globe.
  The Team

comments.content: In your description you stated hundreds of hours of footage have already been shot. $162000+ were raised. We don't expect Oscar-winning material (though you did, at the outset, somewhat amusingly state you were going for that) -- we're fine with film-school-level work, or even home-video-level work. But please, give us what we believed in and backed: Michele's story, raw and honest, the way she wanted it to be seen.

I'm very puzzled that you said you didn't raise enough to fund a full length film about Lady Ganga. That is what we funded, and you exceeded your stated goal. Then it was like you decided to expand your vision, and go off in another direction, leaving your pledgers high and dry. The closest I got to seeing the actual story was the trailer. I'm sorry, but that is not acceptable. You were not to receive any funding from Kickstarter if you didn't raise enough money to deliver on your promises. But you did raise enough, so you received our money, and now you are bailing out on us. Good for you for whatever you are doing to raise awareness, but I'm disappointed in your bait and switch and bail.
Ok, I see. I had totally missed that. I really hope that the film will be made some day!
How is the process going on the main documentary "Lady Ganga"?
Have not received my DVD yet. Last email I can find was on 10/6/16 promising "Please don't despair, we are still going to be sending out DVDs, Blu Rays and posters."
Hi guys, just to clarify, is there a full-length doccie of Michelle's journey available to watch, or only Nilza's Story? Thanks so much.
I'm a little confused -- is the film that is being languaged, subtitled and prepped for shipping a feature-length film? Or is the 15-min short all there is?
Any updates on shipping?
Frederic, when will we be receiving the digital download for the short that launched in London on November? I would really like to see the short film. Thank you.
How long do you envision the complete documentary film to be?
Hi, I was just curious when this film will be available? Any updates?
I think an update is way over due.

I was hoping someone would send me a copy of the movie. Other Kickstarter projects I helped at the same time have produced something, and it seems about time to reward the backers, and not with a song...
Thanks Frederic, look forward to it! For me the best part of any KS project is the sharing of the path to the final delivery, with all its up and downs.
Hi, I think your backers would appreciate a project update, since it is 3 months the project got funded. Thank you!
-Jen
Fantastic!! This is an inspiring project created by an inspiring lady. We are looking forward to seeing the completed movie in New Mexico!!
Yeah! You closed the deal congratulations!!! Now, time to reduce the burden of HPV Associated Cancers! (HAC's). You all Rock!!!

How absolutely fantastic! I was moved beyond words by the clip, so I can only imagine how extraordinary the film will be. But how could it be anything but, given the subject. Thank you for your talent and vision, and for giving us all the chance to be a part of it!
This is so meaningful to me, thank you all!

Yes! This is great! I was lucky enough to meet Michele, and even though it was only briefly she was a such a strong, positive woman. How wonderful to see the project triple its needed funding, it will go a long way toward helping and inspiring so many others. Can't wait to see what happens, and congratulations to everyone involved.
Usha Menon
Katherine: your experience has caused you to have exactly the awareness that Michele wanted women the world over to have! Thanks so for your support and kind remarks. Ruth Frazier, Michele's mother.
Love, Katherine Kahoun
Vincenzo Cosentino
Thank you for helping her wish become a reality, for all of us.
This is so beautiful. The clip was touching and inspiring. I can't wait for the finished documentary. xx

Très heureuse de participer à ce projet que je trouve juste magnifique !!! Toutes mes pensées vont vers Michele Baldwin et toutes ces femmes courageuses qui ne baissent pas les bras, face à la maladie. Et je partage un maximum pour faire connaître Lady Ganga autour de moi. Keep up the wonderful work.

Michele's mother here: your response to Michele's message is just what she would want to hear: pass it on and far and as fast as possible. Help save lives. These connecting the dots are a vital part of the whole process. Namaste.
david & Maria
ST

Why can't we do more? Stigma associated with cervical cancer diagnosis is a major barrier to prevention and screening in some countries. Any movement aimed towards controlling this disease should focus on spreading widespread awareness and breaking cultural barriers about discussing sexual issues. "LADY GANGA" is one such movement!! After just watching two minutes of your short clip, I started feeling powerfully inspired, motivated and responsible! Thank you very much for your selfless attempt towards spreading Michele's message. I am sure this movie can achieve great milestones in fight against cervical cancer.
While you are seeing this, see the National Cervical Cancer Coalition (NCCC) at www.nccc-online.org The NCCC is very supportive of this video being made, PEACE, Alan

An important message to STOPCANCERNOW!!!! PLEASE check this out and help Stop Cancer BEFORE it invades a persons body and home. Your help is IMPORTANT! PLEASE PLEASE help TODAY...Now... thanxxx PEACE PEACE PEACE Alan

This is my first time backing a Kickstarter project, and I could not be happier to have picked the one I did. I read the article about Lady Ganga on CNN and was moved to tears while watching the video. Thank you very much for the important work you guys are doing in making this documentary! Wish you the best of luck!

I have late stage cervical cancer and have been given 2-3 years to live. I gave everything I could afford. I'm crying as I write this because I am so happy to see a film raising awareness about this disease, it is so desperately needed. Thank you for making this film. I hope I live long enough to see it completed.
Thanks Frederic and Mark for taking on this inspirational story of this brave lady and raising awareness on cervical cancer. Looking forward to the release of this documentary.

I've never considered even looking at these crowd funding sites, but I like everyone else was so moved by your beautifully told story that I was compelled to do so. I have worked in women's health for more than 11 years and I know the devastation this disease can wrought. I sincerely hope and pray this reaches all your intended audiences
Thank you, congrats and keep the great work Frederic & Mark!
Dr K

I am so excited to see the goal amount was met and cannot wait to see the pledges in another 28 days. I have to say thank you to all of those that will be involved in making this film. Just reading and watching that small clip has only given us a blip into who Michele is. In those short minutes, I can't help thinking that she is someone who I think any young girl would hope their future selves can be. I can only hope to strive to live my life with strength and peace and know that I have left my mark on those I have come into contact with. Michele will continue to live on in others hearts and thoughts as they watch the film and have the honor of getting to know her for the length of the film. Thank you to Michele and her wonderful children and family for being an inspiration to women everywhere, and bringing awareness to a disease that many don’t even think about.

As a woman who has been diagnosed with HPV, I cannot express strongly enough how important it is to educate women and men about this disease and how to prevent it. I am inspired that such a beautiful and brave woman like MIchele Baldwin so selflessly gave of her diminished time here to raise awareness. I am grateful to both Frederic and Mark for sharing her story...and her light I only wish I had more to give.
National Cervical Cancer Coalition / American Sexual Health Association

I pledge in hopes that this preventable disease is eradicated. I am so sad for the loss of what appears to be such a lovely woman. I am sad for her family. I am sad for her friends and loved ones. Very powerful clip and I can't wait to see the end result. Good luck and I am sure her spirit is soaring : )

Can you be both humbled and thrilled at the same time? We, Michele's parents, are indeed at this incredible response to her #1 wish while dying: a film with her message, made visually beautiful and brutally honest: end cervical cancer. Prevent/treat HPV. Celebrate life every moment. Thanks Frederic and Mark, and every single donor to this effort.
I'm tearing up watching the clip. What an amazing and courageous human being! Am looking forward to watching the movie. Thank you!!

My heart is still so sad without my Shelly.....but some how seeing her in your movie helped me find a small sense of peace today......thank you from the bottom of my heart for working to share this amazing story of courage and love!!!!!!!
What a touching Story, thanks for making it into a film which can inspired us all in our life.
Wish you and your team all the best, Frederic. Looking forward to the documentary.
By the way, you're featured on CNN.com which is where I found this project.
Gave what little I could. Not much but I hope it helps to spread the message. I would love to see film. Thanks for all your hard work guys. Good luck! Sharing on FB now :)

Wish you all good luck in making this movie a success. Hopefully the required budget is funded by the deadline and the movie is distributed across the globe. Even a single life saved is worth every effort.

campaign.story:
STRETCH GOALS
Thank you all for helping us reach our initial goal of $15,000. We're now excited to introduce our stretch goals for Llama Nation: The Documentary.
$20,000
If we reach our stretch goal of $20,000 we will offer a downloadable version of the film's score/soundtrack and also a digital photo book of all of our travels while making this film. Both of these rewards will be included on pledge amounts of $25 and up. 
Please keep pledging and let's well exceed our initial goal. Thank you all! It's been amazing to witness the outpouring of support so far with our campaign.
Llama Nation: The Documentary
Llama Nation is a documentary about llamas. It highlights the breeding, showing, packing, and the love people have for llamas. Our goal is to show the side of llamas that most of America has never seen. The general population has a very small understanding of what purposes the animal can serve or even their origin. The only association most people have with a llama is from a petting zoo at their local country fair, the llamas with hats YouTube video, and Napoleon Dynamite.
Through the film you will meet people who have a true passion for llamas, and you will come to love the animal just as they do. Each character has a unique story, and unique uses for the Llama. We are sharing their stories to inspire, inform and change people's perception of the Llama.
The main goal at the end of the documentary is to have people walk away with a desire and be inspired to love something and to have as much passion about it as the people who love llamas do.
The cornerstone of our story is centered around two girls in the southern US who are in direct competition for the title of National Llama Showing Grand Champion at only 16 years old. The two girls placed 2nd and 3rd nationally last year against people 3 times their age. This year, they have been training year-round in hopes to finally take home the coveted title of National Grand Champion. 
We have been in production since February of 2014. We’ve traveled everywhere in the US from Oregon to North Carolina filming this story. The tale of llamas runs so deep all across the US and we’ve been fortunate enough to go out and capture these. We’re 85% of the way through production and need additional funding of $15,000 to complete filming and to complete the post-production. We really need your help to finish Llama Nation: The Documentary!
Meet Janessa
    Llama showing is Janessa’s life and that is a scientific fact. In 2013, she won the National Reserve Grand Champion title, second place, at only 15 years old. This year Janessa has hit the show arena with a vengeance. She wants the Grand Champion title and has been working hard and showing all year to built up to it. The only thing that stands in her way is her biggest competitor, Hunter.
Interesting fact: Janessa has won 582 ribbons from llama showing.
Meet Hunter
Hunter hangs her llama wool hat in a small town outside of Athens Georgia. At only 15 years old she is financially self sufficient by the funds she raises with her small llama farm. Through the money she makes on her farm, she's able to pay her way to all of the shows that qualify her for the National Championships. She has devoted her whole year to winning the Grand Champion title and nothing will stand in her way, except Janessa.
We follow Hunter as she directly competes with Janessa throughout the entire year trying to win the title of National Grand Champion.
Meet Jack and Tracy
If you’ve ever wanted to know who the godfather and godmother of llamas and llama showing in the US is, it’s Jack and Tracy. Throughout the 30 years they’ve owned llamas they've built up the largest llama ranch east of the Mississippi that houses nearly 200 show quality llamas.  They have contributed greatly to the domestication and healthcare of llamas in the United States. They also organized the first llama show in the southern US and have contributed countless hours and endless effort to bettering and establishing the llama community to what it is today. 
Meet Maggie
  Maggie was first introduced to llamas when she took her rabbit into the vet for a check up. The very nice vet tech noticed Maggie's love for animals and invited her out the the local 4-H meeting where they train with llamas.While there she caught the llama loving bug.
Aside from showing, Maggie also visits the local children's hospitals to talk to the patients and so they can see how great llamas can be. In the words of Maggie, "Llamas just make me feel happy inside. I just want to give them a big hug."
Meet Ron
Ron is the llama carting king. He is also the mayor of a small town in Georgia. Through two decades he has trained countless llamas in the art of pulling a buggy around. He literally wrote the book on cart driving with llamas. He first had his fascination with llamas through watching a news program that was featuring a local farm. Since that day, he's caught the llama bug. 
As mayor of this small town, Ron has introduced many people to the love of llamas including the town sheriff and the county judge. Since his election in 2013, he's been introducing a lot of improvements to the community to not only benefit the life of the citizens but also to benefit the life of the llamas in the town. 
Ron has been out of showing competitively for about a decade. He's finally decided to pick back up the saddle and hit the rink. With the competition more fierce, he can only hope to succeed.  
Meet Chrissy and Allan
   Not many people can claim llamas as their full-time gig. However, Chrissy and Allan can. Three times a week they hike 14 miles and 3,000 feet of elevation gain with 8 llamas up the Smokey Mountains. They do this to deliver supplies up the the Leconte Lodge at the top of the peak. There's no way to access the lodge other than by hiking and that's where the llamas excel. 
Because llamas have such padded feet they can navigate the trails without a trace. The Leconte Lodge has been employing llamas since the 70's to help preserve the forest. 
Chrissy and Allan met on the trail and are now married.
We’re proud to be offering some very unique rewards with our Kickstarter campaign. You can find a full list of them to the right column. Some of our most unique rewards are: llama beans to fertilize your garden, have a llama named after you, llama cart driving lessons with the llama carting king, and to come and visit Jack and Tracy’s Llama Ranch in Georgia.
The Poster
We’re offering a Kickstarter exclusive art print movie poster. It will be printed 11x17 and be shipped right to your door. It will be featured in a nice satin print and have a full bleed. Hang it in your house or apartment to show your love for llamas and Llama Nation: The Documentary
Artwork by Connary Fagen at connary.com
The Shirts
We’re offering two options for our t-shirt rewards. Each will be printed on soft material and will be a shirt you’ll be proud to wear around town. We’ll contact you in regards to sizing and which shirt style you would like. We’ll be offering our classic t-shirt and also our art print shirt. 
The Beans
You might think we're joking here but we're not shitting you. Llama beans are almost as magical as the animal itself. It's surprisingly an excellent fertilizer and cultivated ancient peruvian cultures for centuries. Don't take our word for it but take our good friend Rusty's. 
PLAY

Each bag of natural and organic llama beans will contain one heaping cup and come complete with a recipe on how to fertilize your plants to the most amazing possibilities ever imagined. In case you don't have a plant or garden you're in luck because coal from Santa is so 2013. You can now get with the times and help santa give out llama beans instead of coal this holiday season. It will be shipped just in time for the holidays. 
Check out this article by National Geographic on how llama beans are cleaning up the Bolivian water supply here.
Tanner Shinnick/ Director/ Co-Executive Producer
Tanner was raised by llamas. No but seriously he was born on a llama farm.  He was actually called "Llama Boy" in high school.  Aside from llama documentaries, he is an Emmy Award winning director who has shot and directed national commercial campaigns and feature length documentaries. 
He can smell llama spit from a mile away. 
Aaron Egbert Allsop/ Co-Executive Producer
Aaron Egbert Allsop was raised by a pack of wolves in northern Wisconsin. After living in Honduras for two years he moved to Idaho to get domesticated and go to college. There he met Tanner who was looking for someone to film him who had both a green screen and a pirate costume to supply (true story.) Fortunately Aaron had both and has been working with Tanner and John ever since making movies. To put it short, Aaron spends his time on Llama Nation: The Documentary making sure everything gets done. 
John Meier/ Assistant Director/Co-Executive Producer
John loves to go on adventures and journeys. Each adventure has brought new insights to his life and filmmaking career. One of those adventures took him to Colorado where he and Tanner decided to change the world through the medium of film. Llama Nation: The Documentary is only the start of that journey. 
Lars Lindstrom / Director of Photography
Lars met his first llama at a country fair when he was 12. It was love at first sight. Lars is an LA based cinematographer with an MFA in cinematography from the Art Center. Aside from Llama Nation: The Documentary, Lars has shot music videos that have premiered on BET and also was the DP for a documentary with PBS. 
Tucker Debevec/ Associate Producer/Cinematographer
Tucker Debevec is a country boy at heart with a big city attitude.  Originally from Mississippi, he somehow found his way to Idaho.  After some college at BYU-IDAHO he decided to pursue his dream and knowledge of filmmaking with some awesome friends (Tanner, John, Aaron) .  His love for film is as strong as his love for llamas.  He currently works as a full-time cinematographer for bodybuilding.com and loves every second of it.  When he’s not anxiously waiting for the next season of Game of Thrones then he’s busy trying to eat healthy.  
Danno Ard/ Associate Producer
Most kids had a stuffed bear growing up. Danno had a stuffed llama. He is an award winning producer, director and designer with a background in film production, advertising and web design. He is a new creative who aims to engage, inspire and excite his audiences. At his core, he lives to bring his and other's ideas to life hoping to inspire others to believe in themselves. 
Danno is also a Co-Founder/ UX Producer at DNA Visual Studio and a connoisseur of grilled cheese sandwiches.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our biggest challenge at this time is distribution. Currently we are still seeking a final distribution method. Ideally, we'd love to see this film on Netflix and have a successful festival run. 
All of this is contingent on finding the right distribution partner and securing a plan with them to get the film in front of as many people as possible. We hope a successful festival run and screening will open up these windows of possibilities but we can never be certain. However, we are certain that we have an amazing story that we feel the world wants to see.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Llama Nation release and Backer Screening
updates.update_content:
These last few months have been crazy for llamas, right?! There were on the loose in Arizona, llamas featured in Vogue and also an article in Oprah's magazine. It's great to see llamas get press which in return raises awareness about the film. 
The Edit
Our editor, Aaron, has been tirelessly working on finishing the film. We are currently 75% of the way complete with the film. It's really coming together beautifully and we love how all of the characters are evolving throughout the film. It's just as unique of a story, if not more, as we had planned in the beginning.

Hi Everyone! 
We hope that you're all enjoying the New Year!
2015 has brought a lot of exciting things to the Llama Nation Team so far. We thought we'd fill you in on some of the things that have been happening around here. 
The Soundtrack

Wow! This has been an amazing campaign. We want to sincerely thank you all for such a HUGE amount of support here for the last 30 days. It's been great to see such a large out pouring of support and to meet a lot of you along the way. 
Since we exceeded our goal, we'll be able to do some really great things with LN. We're going to be working with a great team of musicians, Deep Love (www.deeploveopera.com) to create a custom score and soundtrack for the film.

Thank you!
All of you made this possible. Thank you all for your part in helping us reach this goal! We're all really excited to finish the documentary and for you all to see it. As of right now, we're 109% funded! Definitely something to celebrate about. 
Now that we've reached our initial goal of $15,000 we'd like to introduce our stretch goals for the remainder of the project, 3 days.
