campaign.story:
http://www.charitysa.co.za/oasis-reach-for-your-dreams.html
http://oasissa.wordpress.com/our-programes/
ONCE UPON A TIME IN THE SLUMS OF SOUTH AFRICA … 
There was this guy with the name Cliffy, and this other guy with the name Ricky and this third guy with the name Trevor that believed that there must be a way out of gangsterism and drug smuggling, for they could see that the youth of South Africa was suffering being out there in the streets. 
They thought and thought and decided to create a street soccer team.
The years went by and the gang was growing so this guy with the name Cliffy, and this other guy with the name Ricky and this third guy with the name Trevor, wanted to offer more. 
And so they made a Non Profit Organization with the name “Oasis Reaching For Your Dreams” . 
“Oasis” is now the home and a shelter for hundreds of kids. 
I am a crazy film maker with the name Valentina with the dream of changing the world using my camera. 
Let me tell you a story. 
Once upon a time there was this crazy, film maker that wanted to change the world, and so she started following Cliffy and his gang. She followed them in a life – changing journey in Poznan – Poland where they took part in the Homeless World Cup. 
She saw them transform from gangsters, drug smugglers, criminals into healthy members of the society. 
Now, a year later, they are back, patrolling the slums of South Africa trying to keep the kids away from the streets. 
I want to tell you this story because I believe in second chances. 
I need your help. 
It’s time for this tale to be told. 
Why now? 
“Oasis Reaching For Your Dreams” is struggling financially. If someone crazy enough doesn’t tell their story, there is a big possibility that the Organization will not continue to operate. 
For over a year now I saw the work is being done and it is time for you too to find out. 
Maybe this story might inspire other people in other countries too. 
Maybe it will keep away your kid from the streets. 
Most importantly though, it will continue providing shelter to kids in need of support and guidance. 
Be a part of this. 
We want to show this film in festivals but also in schools. Please make our story known by sharing on FACEBOOK and TWITTER. We know that we set an ambitious goal but we need to go back in South Africa for some extra shooting and we need to complete this film. 
Please donate
We are less than 20 days away form our Kickstarter Campaign completion.
Please donate in order to shed some light on this inspiring story. 
EVERY POUND COUNTS
Your contribution is greatly important because by donating not only you are helping us to tell this story but you are also showing us trust that eventually we will deliver what we have promised. 
We want to create a pool of communication with you and continue sharing ideas even when this documentary is completed. 
Now is the time. 
Because of the financial issues, there is a big possibility that “Oasis” wont make it to the 12th Homeless World Cup in Santiago – Chile that takes place 19th – 26th of October. 
We need to act. 
http://www.districtmail.com/articles/articledetails.aspx?id=78722 
TURNING POINT "the journey"
ABOUT THE STORY 
Turning Point "the journey" is a feature length documentary that tells the story of Cliffy and his "gang" towards a life-changing trip in Poznan - Poland where the 11th Homeless World Cup is held and their return in South Africa. I am following them for over a year now. 
After a game with Chile, we got defeated by 9-1
Who is “OASIS REACHING FOR YOUR DREAMS” ? 
Find out more by visiting this link 
http://www.streetfootballworld.org/network-member/oasis
http://sahss.org.za/
In South Africa, Yusi now is a part of Oasis' programs helping youth and using soccer as a tool
 We are in constant communication with Bongani – an ex player that is now a coach of the team – and we are planning to actually go to the disadvantaged areas of South Africa and explore the reasons that are forcing youth of young age to mingle with drug dealing and gangsterism. Once the documentary is finished not only it will be submitted in festivals around the world but we want to use it as a tool in South Africa and elsewhere to prove to people that drugs are not a mere social issue; they are a nicely figured out plan to keep masses occupied; it is not accidental that in most countries undergoing a severe economic crisis – Europe included – drug smuggling is increasing rapidly. Cheap drugs bombarding the world aiming disadvantaged people. 
http://www.anthonyepes.com/homelessworldcup/h2e8301ed
How can you help
Keep posting, keep sharing, keep talking about our story! Believe it or not by posting on FACEBOOK or commenting on Twitter you're helping a  great deal. 
Every pound counts! We need you, we need you and your friends and your friends' friends to jump in this cause and help us! It doest have to be much, every pound counts! 
Where does your money go?
Equipment rental
Transportation - Plane tickets - Accommodation 
Filming
Editing
Color Correction
Original score
Sound mixing (we are shooting in difficult environments hence we 'll need post to save some "unpleasant" situations)
Location access 
Legal advice
Licensing 
Clearings
Festival entry fees
Distribution
Publicity
Web Design and Hosting 
Where we stand at the moment ?
We shot most of the footage but we need to travel in Chile and South Africa to complete the story.It is very important as crucial changes have happened in our heroes lives. Plus we need to capture Oasis' struggle to remain alive and put it out there on the screen to alert people. 
Production's Rough Schedule
August 2013 Filming principle photography in Poznan Poland.
September - December 2013: Organize, Log and Load footage. Editorial begins.
October 2014: We will return to film additional footage in Santiago Chile where the 2014th Homeless World Cup will take place. 
November 2014: Log/Load remaining footage.
March-October 2014: Editorial. Music composing starts.

November-December 2014: Edit locked. Music Composing, sound mix/design, color grade and finishing. Film festival submissions start.

January 2015: Film is completed for festival circuit.
Please note that any additional funds raised will go towards the budget of the next documentary we are planning. 
Please keep in touch with Turning Point at
https://www.facebook.com/turningpointdocumentary
and on Twitter 
@TurningPointDoc
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I promise to send out regular project updates, in that way you will be able to know if everything runs smoothly or not and if we are facing any obstacles - hopefully not - we'll then be able to address them and overcome them by informing you and rescheduling. 

I am fully aware that because of the fact that I am a young filmmaker and this is my first feature some might find it difficult to trust me. I am willing to do everything in my power to prove myself. Also the fact that the documentary is close to it's completion gives some sort of reassurance that eventually we'll deliver what we are promising. 

Because of the way I am working (observational style) the filming procedure might be a bit slow until we get some coherent footage. So this is something to keep in mind too, but it should be fine because until now I did not experience any issues.

I would also like to add that delivering the rewards might be a bit slow because of the volume of work we 'll need to cover, I will though put a team together along the journey to help me out so everything goes according to plan.

My biggest fear in such occasions - filming publicly and having a lot of people shown in the footage - is that we might get slowed down because of not being able to get the relevant access or release forms. I am trying to prevent such a thing by planning ahead very carefully.

campaign.story:
Hello, my name is Mark Tuschman, and I’m a professional photographer of 35 years. For the past decade I have been on a mission to document the lack of autonomy that millions of women in developing countries have over their own lives and bodies. Through my photography, I bring these women and their stories to the forefront of global consciousness.
At the same time, this book documents the many advances being made in educating and empowering women and girls. Doctors, nurses, teachers, aid workers, and NGO staff – these are the silent heroes who are working tirelessly to improve the lives of millions of women around the world. This book showcases the noble work they do.
In Dhaka, Bangladesh, this woman just received a long-term birth control implant. She is being counseled by her physician.
Faces of Courage is unique – no other photo-documentary has portrayed the full scope of this human drama as it unfolds around the world, including the efforts to help women move from tragedy and despair to hope and triumph.
You can read many articles about women in peril, and you can find reams of appalling statistics in countless reports and journals. But to me, these portraits of individual girls and women communicate in a much more direct and compelling way. They tell the story of our changing world, with an eloquence that words can never match.
Rajasthan, India – Two young girls from a rural village. One must stay at home to look after her younger siblings and the goats, while the other is supported by her mother to attend school.
The legendary Milton Glaser is the book’s designer, and we already have a commitment from a wonderful publisher. But the book will not become a reality without your support.
In­­­ the new world of publishing in the digital age, artistic photo-essays have to be subsidized. I also have to compensate the designer and the editor, so I need to raise at least $50,000. I feel that I have a commitment to all of the women whom I’ve photographed over the years, to tell their stories and to add momentum to the movements that are tirelessly working to empower them. With your help, we can share their voices with as wide an audience as possible.
Here are some sample pages from the first chapter, to give you a better sense of the photographs and the book’s layout.
Faces of Courage is very timely, as there is a growing movement in the United States and abroad that is hungry for real, substantive content on women’s human rights; readers yearn to explore and understand more fully the facts and issues involved.
Its hopeful message will make the book an effective communication tool, while shedding light on the heroic work of the small, grassroots organizations featured throughout. As the book’s images and stories show, the struggle of women to gain autonomy over their own lives is a battle of epic proportions. These photo essays heavily emphasize the positive impacts of family planning and girls’ education.
Mother and infant in Kumasi, Kenya
Where reproductive healthcare exists, we have the opportunity to make critical differences in protecting the rights and voices of women, which will go a long way toward alleviating poverty and stimulating economic productivity. 
I have documented many programs that have produced results, but even the most effective programs need to be scaled up by many orders of magnitude to serve the huge populations in need. With this goal in mind, Faces of Courage and the accompanying website and PR campaign are geared toward raising consciousness and inspiring activists to support programs serving women in need around the world. 
Midwife and expectant mother in Otavalo, Ecuador
I have been asked more than once why, as a man, am I focused on the rights of women? The answer is simple: because they are a human-rights issue, not just a female issue. Millions of women face travails on a daily basis that are an outrage and totally unacceptable; for example, some are trafficked and bound in contemporary forms of slavery.
How can you help?
Please explore the rewards we are offering below and donate as much as possible. And no matter how little or how much you can give, please share this website and project with your friends, family, and colleagues. I am not of the “social media” generation, so I need your help to spread the word about Faces of Courage, both personally and online.
Please connect with me on my new Facebook page and on Twitter @marktuschman and @CourageFaces.
While we need a minimum of $50,000 to make this book a reality, ideally we’re trying to raise an additional $20,000, which will allow us to launch a massive PR campaign to highlight the issues and organizations featured in the book. Any funds that we raise over $70,000 will allow us to send copies of the book to schools, libraries, and cultural centers, and to the many foundations whose work is documented in Faces of Courage.
I hope that you find these portraits and stories inspiring, and that you will consider becoming a backer of this important and timely project.
Mark Tuschman
mark@tuschmanphoto.com
There are a variety of rewards for you to choose from. You will find all the details below and please do get in touch if you have any questions.
Be one of the first to back the project, and receive one of only 100 early bird rewards at this level – a signed copy of Faces of Courage for only $65.
*For all sizes of print, please choose the image you would like from the grid of 16 photographs at the bottom of this section – all of these photographs are featured in the book Faces of Courage.

At this pledge level you will receive two copies of Faces of Courage for $75 each – one for you and one for a friend.
Be one of the first to back the project, and receive one of only 75 early bird rewards at this level – a signed copy of Faces of Courage for only $70 and a beautiful 8x10" archival print from the book for only $115.
At this pledge level you will receive three copies of Faces of Courage for only $70 each.
Be one of the first to back the project, and receive one of only 50 rewards at this level – a signed copy of Faces of Courage for the early bird price of $65 and a beautiful 12x18" large archival print from the book for only $360.
*When choosing which image you would like for your print(s), please select from the grid below. This applies for all sizes of print. To see larger versions of the photographs before you choose, please go to the Kickstarter Prints Gallery on my website.
For the past 35 years I have traveled the world as a photographer. My clients include WomenDeliver, the United Nations Population Fund, the Packard Foundation, EngenderHealth, Planned Parenthood, the Global Fund for Women, numerous other foundations and NGOs, and many corporate clients.
My work has won several international photography competitions, including the Global Health Council Photographer of the Year award and the SocialDocumentary.net / MSH Photography Fellowship Grand Prize. I was also the featured exhibiting photographer at the WomenDeliver international conference in Malaysia in 2013.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With a publishing project like this, the biggest risk is usually delay. However, in this case, I don't foresee any major risks. Most of the work has been done, including 75% of the writing, and all of the photography. I already have an experienced designer and printer on board, and we have accurate printing and shipping costs from one of the best printers from Japan, plus an excellent distributor. If we raise the funds the book will be published.

Although this is my first Kickstarter project, I have done my homework and am fully aware of the challenges presented by fulfilling the rewards, and have set aside the time and accounted for the resources necessary for the packaging and shipping.

The book will be shipped from the US, and the cost for shipping such a large and heavy book is quite high. If you live outside of the US, please add the extra shipping costs as indicated on each individual reward level where applicable. I appreciate your understanding and thank you in advance, and please do get in touch with me if you have any questions.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Faces of Courage: A #MeToo for the Women of the World
updates.update_content:
Dear Friends,
Back in 2015, when I published "Faces of Courage" -- with your support -- I had one primary goal in mind: To illustrate a cause and to give voice to the millions of women around the world who have no voice -- and no means of protecting themselves against almost daily assaults on their dignity and on their basic human rights. As you know, thanks to the women I portrayed, "Faces of Courage" gained important attention. Former President Jimmy Carter endorsed the book and gave it a prominent place in his ongoing campaign for promoting human rights. And American Photo magazine named the book as one of the best photo books of 2015.

As many of you know, I have spent over a decade documenting the lack of human rights experienced by many women in Africa, Asia and Latin America. Hearing the stories of physically and sexually abused women is emotionally distressing and I have never understood how men can treat women as sexual objects without any regard for their dignity and humanity. And when I try to examine some of the root causes, it always comes down to cultural acceptance. This brings me to our current sad state of affairs with the upcoming Presidential election.

We know people are passionate about politics; but until now, we haven’t known why. “Why The Divide?” will reveal the science behind the emotions that drive political beliefs.
In the midst of the craziest election cycle in recent memory, I and my good friend, Michael Stringer, have been in pre-production on a Documentary Film we’re calling, Why the Divide?: The Science Behind Our Political Differences, which will reveal the surprising impact of DNA on our political choices! This is a personal passion project that we think is both timely and important. updates.update_userinfo: Faces of Courage book website and book launch events
updates.update_content:
Faces of Courage has a new website: http://facesofcouragebook2015.com
All currently scheduled events and upcoming reviews will be listed on the website, but for your convenience the current ones are listed below.
If you live in the SF Bay Area there are 2 upcoming events: 
September 16th, 12 noon at Kepler’s Books in Menlo Park – interview with award winning Bay Area journalist Angie Coiro.

Hi,
They arrived 1 hour ago on two palettes- 3600 lbs of books! It is a very exciting moment for me- a culminations of years of work. Now I want to get the books to you as soon as possible. I have to order some protective mailers but if you live on the peninsula, there are two alternatives for you to come by and pick it up:
Tomorrow ( Sunday) at my home between 3-6 pm 300 Santa Monica in Menlo Park

On Monday I received by air mail from Hong Kong a copy of the book. It was a very exciting moment- the culmination of almost 13 years of work. With bated breath I opened the shrink wrap and happy to report that the book has been reproduced beautifully. I can't wait to send your book(s) to you. 
The books are on a boat now and I will send out one more email when I expect them to arrive- 3-4 weeks would be a good approximation. If you are in the SF Bay Area, I will have some open houses where you can have the option of coming over and picking it up- otherwise they will be mailed.

At long last, Faces of Courage is now on press. The proofs I received were excellent so it was unnecessary for me to go to Hong Kong for the press check. The printing rep for Toppan printing has been fabulous in facilitating this entire process. I expect the book to begin shipping towards the end of the month.
I will send out two more updates- one when the books will be shipping from Hong Kong and the last when I have them in my hands. As soon as I do, it will be my pleasure to send Faces of Courage to all of you who ordered copies.  The official book launch events will be in October and I will notify you as dates and venue become specific.
